contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox_River | river_name = Záncara | image_name = Rio zancara con agua pm.JPG | image_size = | caption = The Záncara near [[Pedro Muñoz]] | origin = [[Abia de la Obispalía]], [[Province of Cuenca (Spain)|Cuenca Province]]<br>({{flag|Castile-La Mancha}}) | mouth = [[Cigüela]] | basin_countries = Spain | length = 168 km | elevation = 1020 m | mouth_elevation = 630 m | discharge = 1.93 m³/s | watershed = 5726 km² }} The '''Záncara''' is a 168 km long river in [[Castile-La Mancha]], Spain. It is a tributary to the [[Cigüela]], a tributary of the [[Guadiana]]. Its source is near the village [[Abia de la Obispalía]], west of [[Cuenca, Spain|Cuenca]], in the [[Sistema Ibérico|Iberian System]]. The Záncara flows southwest, along the town of [[Socuéllamos]]. Its main tributaries are the [[Rus River|Rus]], [[Saona River|Saona]] and [[Río Córcoles|Córcoles]]. It flows into the Cigüela from the left near the [[Ojos del Guadiana]], [[Villarrubia de los Ojos]] municipal term. There are authors though that claim that it is the Cigüela that flows into the Záncara.<ref>ALMAGRO COSTA, Juan, 2006. ''Las huellas del Guadiana'' Org. Auton. Parques Nacionales. MMA. ISBN 84-8014-643-5</ref> == See also == * [[List of rivers of Spain]] == References== {{reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.chguadiana.es/ Confederación hidrográfica del Guadiana] {{coord|39|24|N|2|57|W|source:cawiki_region:ES_type:river|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zancara}} [[Category:Rivers of Spain]] {{CastileLaMancha-geo-stub}}
